info.title: ISBM 2.0
info.description: An OpenAPI specification for the ISBM 2.0 RESTful interface.

tags.name: ChannelManagement
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Channel Management Service.

tags.name: ConsumerPublicationService
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Consumer Publication Service.

tags.name: ConsumerRequestService
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Consumer Request Service.

tags.name: ProviderPublicationService
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Provider Publication Service.

tags.name: ProviderRequestService
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Provider Request Service.

tags.name: ConfigurationDiscoveryService
tags.description: REST version of the ISBM 2.0 Configuration Discovery Service.

get.summary: Get metadata from the root of the API

200.description: The OpenAPI document for the full suite of services available at this endpoint.

get.summary: Retrieve all the channels, subject to security permissions.

post.summary: Create a new channel with the specified URI path fragment.

channelWithTokens.summary: Simple example of Channel including initial SecurityTokens.

201.description: The newly created Channel, excluding any configured security tokens.

channelWithTokensResponse.summary: Simple example of Channel including initial SecurityTokens.

409.description: Could not create the channel, URI already exists.

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

200.description: The request Channel; excluding associated SecurityTokens.

404.description: The requested Channel does not exist.
The requested Channel does not exist.

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

post.summary: Adds security tokens to a channel.

addingSecurityTokens.summary: Simple example of adding security tokens to a Channel.

201.description: Tokens have been added to the Channel.

404.description: The requested Channel does not exist.

409.description: The requested Channel has no security tokens and must not be assigned any.

delete.summary: Removes security tokens from a channel.

requestBody.description: The security tokens to remove: each token must be specified in full to be removed, i.e., specifying only the username of a UsernamePassword token is insufficient.

removingSecurityTokens.summary: Simple example of removing security tokens from a Channel.

204.description: Security tokens successfully removed from the channel.

404.description: The requested Channel does not exist.

409.description: The security tokens do not match those assigned to the Channel.

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

post.summary: Opens a publication session for a channel.

201.description: The publication session has been successfully opened on the channel. Only the SessionID is to be returned.

Location.description: The URL at which the session can be accessed, deleted, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., ChannelURI not a valid URI).

404.description: The Channel does not exists.

422.description: The Channel is not of type Publication.

example.fault: The channel type must be the Publication type

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

post.summary: Opens a subscription session for a channel.

requestBody.description: The configuration of the subscription session, i.e., topic filtering, content-filtering, and notication listener address. Only the Topics, ListenerURL, and FilterExpressions are to be provided.

basicSessionWithListenerUrl.summary: Simple session including the optional listener url.

201.description: The subscription session has been successfully opened on the channel. Only the SessionID is to be returned.

Location.description: The URL at which the session can be accessed, deleted, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., ListenerURL not a valid URI) or duplicate namespaces prefixes in the NamespaceNames list of the FilterExpression.

404.description: The Channel does not exists.

422.description: The Channel is not of type Publication.

example.fault: The channel type must be the Publication type

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

post.summary: Opens a provider request session for a channel for reading requests and posting responses.

requestBody.description: The configuration of the session, i.e., topic filtering, content-filtering, and notication listener address. Only the Topics, ListenerURL, and FilterExpressions are to be provided.

basicSessionWithListenerUrl.summary: Simple session including the optional listener url.

201.description: The session has been successfully opened on the channel. Only the SessionID is to be returned.

Location.description: The URL at which the session can be accessed, deleted, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., ListenerURL not a valid URI) or duplicate namespaces prefixes in the NamespaceNames list of the FilterExpression.

404.description: The Channel does not exists.

422.description: The Channel is not of type Request.

example.fault: The channel type must be the Request type

parameters.name: channel-uri
parameters.description: The identifier of the channel to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

post.summary: Opens a consumer request session for a channel for posting requests and reading responses.

requestBody.description: The configuration of the consumer request session, i.e., optional notication listener address. Only the ListenerURL is to be provided (if desired).

basicSessionWithListenerUrl.summary: Simple session including the optional listener url.

201.description: The session has been successfully opened on the channel. Only the SessionID is to be returned.

Location.description: The URL at which the session can be accessed, deleted, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., ChannelURI not a valid URI, ListenerURL is provided but not a valid URL).

404.description: The Channel does not exists.

422.description: The Channel is not of type Request.

example.fault: The channel type must be the Request type

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to be accessed (retrieved, deleted, modified, etc.)

delete.description:
Closes a session of any type. All unexpired messages that have been posted during the session will be expired.
***Note*** This interface is shared by Close Publication Session, Close Subscription Session, Close Provider Request Session, and Close Consumer Request Session.

404.description: The session does not exist or has been closed.

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the publication was posted.

get.summary: Returns the first non-expired publication message or a previously read expired message that satisfies the session message filters.

200.description:
Returns the first non-expired publication message or a previously read expired message that satisfies the session message filters.
Only MessageID, MessageContent, and Topic are allowed in the response.
**Note:** In contrast to the SOAP web-service, no message is returned as a 404 rather than an "empty" message. This maps better the a RESTful API that is based on the idea of resources. If there are no messages on the queue, the resource does not exist and, hence, 404 should be returned.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Publication Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Publication Consumer for this operation

delete.summary: Removes the first, if any, publication message in the subscription queue.

204.description:
Publication message has been removed from the subscription queue.
**Note:** This response applies even if no messages are in the queue.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Publication Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Publication Consumer for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the message will be posted.

post.summary: Posts a publication message on a channel.

requestBody.description: The Message to be published Only MessageContent, Topic, and Expiry are allowed in the request body.

201.description: The message has been successfully posted to the channel. Returns only the MessageID.

Location.description: The URL at which the message can be accessed, expired, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., no Topic provided, Expiry in invalid format).

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed).

422.description: The Session is not of type Publication Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Publication Provider for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the publication was posted.

parameters.name: message-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the posted publication.

204.description:
Publication has been expired.
If the MessageID does not correspond with the SessionID or the corresponding message has already expired, then no further action is taken.
The message is expired for all topics associated with the message.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed).

422.description: The Session is not of type Publication Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Publication Provider for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the request message was posted.

get.summary: Returns the first non-expired request message or a previously read expired message that satisfies the session message filters.

200.description:
Returns the first non-expired request message or previously read expired message that satisfies the session message filters.
Only MessageID, MessageContent, and Topic are allowed in the response.
Although `topics` is an array, it will only contain 1 value in the context of a request.
**Note:** In contrast to the SOAP web-service, no message is returned as a 404 rather than an "empty" message. This maps better the a RESTful API that is based on the idea of resources. If there are no messages on the queue, the resource does not exist and, hence, 404 should be returned.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Provider

example.fault: The session type must be Request Provider for this operation

delete.summary: Deletes the first request message, if any, in the session message queue.

204.description:
Request message has been removed from the session message queue.
**Note:** This response applies even if no messages are in the queue.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Provider

example.fault: The session type must be Request Provider for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the message will/is posted.

post.summary: Posts a request message on a channel.

requestBody.description: The Message to be published Only MessageContent, Topic, and Expiry are allowed in the request body. Although `topics` is an array, at most 1 value is allowed.

201.description: The message has been successfully posted to the channel. Returns only the MessageID.

Location.description: The URL at which the message can be accessed, expired, etc.

400.description: Error in the provided parameters (e.g., no Topic provided, more than 1 topic provided, Expiry in invalid format).

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed).

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Request Consumer for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the request message was posted.

parameters.name: message-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the posted request.

204.description:
Request has been expired.
If the MessageID does not correspond with the SessionID or the corresponding message has already expired, then no further action is taken.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed).

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Request Consumer for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session at which the response message was recieved.

parameters.name: request-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the origianal request for the response.

get.summary: Returns the first response message, if any, in the session message queue associated with the request.

200.description:
The first response message associated with the request.
Only MessageID and MessageContent are allowed in the response.
**Note:** In contrast to the SOAP web-service, no message is returned as a 404 rather than an "empty" message. This maps better the a RESTful API that is based on the idea of resources. If there are no messages on the queue, the resource does not exist and, hence, 404 should be returned.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Request Consumer for this operation

delete.summary: Deletes the first response message, if any, in the session message queue associated with the request.

204.description:
Response message has been removed from the session message queue associated with the request.
**Note:** This response applies even if no messages are in the queue.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Consumer

example.fault: The session type must be Request Consumer for this operation

parameters.name: session-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the session to which the message will/is posted.

parameters.name: request-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the origianal request for the response.

post.summary: Posts a response message on a channel.

requestBody.description:
The Message to be published.
Only MessageContent is allowed in the request body.

201.description:
The message has been successfully posted to the channel. Returns only the MessageID.
If there is no request message that can be matched to RequestMessageID, then no further action is taken.

Location.description: The URL at which the message can be accessed, expired, etc.

404.description: The session does not exist (or has been closed) or there are no messages to retrieve.

422.description: The Session is not of type Request Provider

example.fault: The session type must be Request Provider for this operation

get.summary: Gets information about the supported operations and features of the ISBM service provider. The purpose of this operation is to allow an application to be configured appropriately to communicate successfully with the service provider.

200.description: Operations supported by the ISBM service provider.

get.summary: Gets the detailed security related information of the ISBM service provider. The security details are exposed only if the connecting application provides a valid SecurityToken. Each application may be assigned a SecurityToken out-of-band by the service provider.

200.description: Detailed security related information of the ISBM service provider.

401.description: The security tokens do not match those assigned to the application (SecurityTokenFault).

securityTokens.description: This can be provided when creating a channel but must never be returned.

FilterExpression.description: content filtering expression that may be applied to messages on a channel

Message.description:
Message Content may be XML, JSON, or possibly an arbitrary type. However, XML and JSON must be supported.
When receiving a Message object as the result of a POST, MUST only include the message ID confirming the creation of the Message.
The message type is implicit based on the context and MUST NOT appear in request/response bodies.

topics.description: The Topic(s) to which the message will be posted.

expiry.description: The duration after which the message will be automatically expired. Negative duration is no duration. Duration as defined by XML Schema xs:duration, http://w3c.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#duration

requestMessageId.description: Only valid for Response messages; refers to the original Request message.

mediaType.description: The MIME type of the content. If not present, it is assumed to be the same as the Content-Type of the HTTP request/response body.

contentEncoding.description: Indicates the encoding type used for binary content.

SecurityToken.description: Exact security token types are implementation specific. Support must be provided for at least UsernameToken.

fault.description: Human readable explanation of the error.

NamespaceFault.description: Returned when duplicate namespace prefixes occur in Namespace parameters.

fault.description: Human readable explanation of the error.
Human readable explanation of the error.

ParameterFault.description: Returned when any given parameter is malformed or not optional but blank. The HTTP response status must be 400.

fault.description: Human readable explanation of the error.
Human readable explanation of the error.

SessionFault.description: Returned when attempting to access a Session of the wrong SessionType.

fault.description: Human readable explanation of the error.

SupportedOperations.description: Gets information about the supported operations and features of the ISBM service provider.

restSupportedAuthenticationSchemes.description: The scheme names must match one of the schemes mentioned in HTTP Authentication Scheme Registry [https://www.iana.org/assignments/http-authschemes/http-authschemes.xhtml].

defaultExpiryDuration.description: Duration as defined by XML Schema xs:duration, http://w3c.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#duration, or  null

SecurityDetails.description: Gets the detailed security related information of the ISBM service provider.
